item.title: Stefers511 add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Stefers511 add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "A woman knows very well that, though a wit sends her his poems, praises her judgment, solicits her criticism, and drinks her tea, this by no means signifies that he respects her opinions, admires her understanding, or will refuse, though the rapier is denied him, to run through the body with his pen." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Stefers511 add a quote by Steve Hall
item.description: "The truest form of love is how you behave toward someone, not how you feel about them." -- Steve Hall

item.title: Stefers511 add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "When we treat people merely as they are, they will remain as they are. When we treat them as if they were what they should be, they will become what they should be. " -- Thomas S. Monson
